properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 10:50AM CST until January 15 at 7:30AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Kentucky...

Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam Headwater affecting Pulaski and
Ballard Counties

.Today is the first day that Olmsted Lock and Dam is officially a
National Weather Service forecast point.  Due to heavy rains earlier
in the month, the Ohio River is already above flood stage, 36 feet,
at this location. The river has crested and is currently undergoing
a slow fall, however, additional rises may be expected in the coming
weeks due to expected rainfall.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam.
* until Wednesday January 15.
* At 10:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 39.4 feet.
* Flood Stage is 36.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to below flood stage by
early Wednesday morning, January 15.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
